intro: Cusparia larensis, commonly known as the Larensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring upright stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female parts, and are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Cusparia larensis is adapted to arid environments, exhibiting drought tolerance and succulent-like features.
